newsitem.title: FRANCE: SOCCER-MONACO WIN FRENCH LEAGUE TITLE.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-MONACO WIN FRENCH LEAGUE TITLE.

text.p: Monaco won the French soccer league title without playing after second-placed Paris St Germain drew 2-2 at home to Bordeaux on Saturday.

The Parisians needed a win to retain some slim hopes of challenging the team from the principality, who host Caen on Sunday. The loss leaves PSG eight points behind Monaco with only two rounds left in the first division.
Paris St Germain opened the scoring through Bruno N'Gotty from a free kick in the 14th minute but former European Footballer of the Year Jean-Pierre Papin equalised in the 39th for Bordeaux.
Kaba Diawara made it 2-1 for Bordeaux in the 88th minute but Brazil's Rai equalised 60 seconds later.
